info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 7:55PM EDT until July 24 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... Northeastern Columbia County in east central New York... Southeastern Rensselaer County in east central New York... Southern Bennington County in southern Vermont... Southern Windham County in southern Vermont... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 754 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bennington to near New Ashford to near Pittsfield to near Housatonic, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Bennington, North Adams, Brattleboro, Adams, Williamstown, Lee, Lenox, Pownal, Cheshire, Vernon, Wilmington, Becket, Otis, Stamford, Readsboro, Florida, Hancock, Savoy and New Ashford. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
